title: Really feels like jungle diversity is worst than ever...
body:
Just saying :(

Edit: title should've said "worse than ever".

replies.body: The framework has been laid to increase diversity, but the new jungle is just a lot more punishing, so fewer champions can jungle effectively as it stands now. A few more patches should see some changes to finally deliver on the diversity that S5 was hoping for.

Give us more pots aye, or maybe just 1 more would be enough.

Recalling after second camp gets annoying after a while.

> [{quoted}](name=SEKAI,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VIJJElJs,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-01-13T03:13:27.070+0000)
>
> Give us more pots aye, or maybe just 1 more would be enough.
> 
> Recalling after second camp gets annoying after a while.

So who has to recall after second camp? I play Sejuani, Rammus, Amumu, Vi, Hecarim and Khazix in the jungle and I've managed a full clear or a level 3 w/close to full HP into a gank on all of them. 

Honestly the only thing that seems F'ed up to me is how I wind up under leveled as fuck no matter what I do as a jungler. I go 1/0/6 as Sej in the lane phase I should not be a level behind my support, period.
How did you spec/start on sej?  I took gromp, then blue, then had to B. lol.

For Sej I usually gromp->blue->red or raptor-> red or raptor then I have to back then come back and smite krugs then just get 4 and gank.

Red or raptor first just depends on smite CD (Smiting red gives 20% hp, so you need that to stay alive), which depends on the leash usually. I don't save smite until the last second, instead using it immediately to get the gromp's smite passive thing and have the CD up sooner. For masteries I take the starting shield thing in the defense tree and the more pot/buff duration stuff, I'm sure those all help. 

That said I still can't even come close to a full clear or lvl 3 with full hp (I'm almost dead after the 4th camp) like MrScotty says.
do you have ruins and masteries?

I was playing Yi jungle recently, a little bit of Sion before. While I can sorta manage to jungle with 2 pots with Sion I can't seem to jungle with Yi without going back once after the first 2 camps. Maybe I am missing something but I think the survivability for the squishier junglers in the early levels needs to get a small look at.

The underlevel thingy also kinda gets me but since I only play normals that's prob why it hasn't bothered me all that much yet as laners generally ain't that far ahead of me for the most part. But still, I am usually a level or sometimes 2 behind other laners.

Now you've mentioned it, true, jungle should also provide slightly more experience.

I don't know your jungle pattern, but with almost any jungler I use ( Shaco, Aatrox, Rengar and Udyr are my primaries), you should get a full clear before backing if you maximize your buff/smite control. The junglers with self sustain at lvl 1 (Aatrox, WW, Xin) are obviously easier to stay in the jungle longer with ganks thrown in, but the others also have the capability. Again, i don't know your play style, but what I do is with the exception of my red and blue, kill those small monsters first, allowing you to focus the larger one and use smite if necessary. Try not to smite wolf or raptor, as the buff isn't as useful IMO. If needed, go smite the large Golem or Gromp, then walk away so as to use that buff to clear another camp that is weaker. I am not pro, but have been jungling as my primary role since the new SR, so please feel free to ask me something more specific. If I don't have the answer, I know some really high end guys that definitely help us get an answer. Jungle is so much fun, and I hate that some people are struggling with it to the point they don't even want to do it any more. I hope this has been some help, keep playing and have fun!

> [{quoted}](name=SEKAI,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VIJJElJs,comment-id=0001000000000001,timestamp=2015-01-13T17:03:32.992+0000)
>
> I was playing Yi jungle recently, a little bit of Sion before. While I can sorta manage to jungle with 2 pots with Sion I can't seem to jungle with Yi without going back once after the first 2 camps. Maybe I am missing something but I think the survivability for the squishier junglers in the early levels needs to get a small look at.
> 
> The underlevel thingy also kinda gets me but since I only play normals that's prob why it hasn't bothered me all that much yet as laners generally ain't that far ahead of me for the most part. But still, I am usually a level or sometimes 2 behind other laners.
> 
> Now you've mentioned it, true, jungle should also provide slightly more experience.

So, this may be completely retarded and I don't play Yi so I'm just spitballing, but what I've done with the champs who had the roughest clears was to split between their usual mastery page and like...12-15 points in the utility tree. With the idea being on, for instance, Nautilus, was that I was taking a strong late game as a given and leaving behind the %extra bonus armor and HP at level 18 and getting myself the Movespeed, Extra starting gold, pot duration and biscuits from Utility. 

That way, my start is machete+3 biscuits that all last 10% longer which adds up to approximately 3.7 pots worth of health vs 2, and my level 1 stats are pretty much the same. I lose maybe 200-300g of stats late, but I already have a strong late game so it's kinda moot as Naut is already a beast late. 

What if you tried sticking with the atkspd, double edged sword, etc stats and dropped the %bonus AD and AD at level 18 from Yi counting on the extra devourer stacks to make up the difference? Bet you a dollar I could get a full clear out of him before I had to back.

Truly interesting I have to say.

Since I think Yi needs an early feed so some full offense tree would be needed but I haven't taken into account that going hybid mastery might actually only resulting a few bucks of stat loss late which can easily be compensated while in exchange for early smoothing.

I would definitely give that one a few runs once I get back to LoL (busy on other games atm hue).

Thanks for the heads up bud.

Maybe you need to learn how to play Yi? I run 21/0/9 masteries and attackspeed and crit runes. I can get a full clear no problem. Just gotta use your alpha strike to dodge jungle camp attacks and get your heal at lvl 2 and 3 for the sustain.

I like to smite and leash golems or wights, do buff (using both pots), get wolves or wraiths, then i back (buy 2 pots and my smite). Then i do buff or golems or wights (depending on which side you start) then i gank.

> [{quoted}](name=MrSc0tty,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VIJJElJs,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-01-13T13:26:58.442+0000)
>
> So who has to recall after second camp? I play Sejuani, Rammus, Amumu, Vi, Hecarim and Khazix in the jungle and I've managed a full clear or a level 3 w/close to full HP into a gank on all of them. 
> 
> Honestly the only thing that seems F'ed up to me is how I wind up under leveled as fuck no matter what I do as a jungler. I go 1/0/6 as Sej in the lane phase I should not be a level behind my support, period.

This is spot on.  There are some champs who have had their clear ability decimated (I'm looking at you poor Evelynn.)

However -- with most champs you can still clear (albeit slowly and painfully.)  However, no matter how great I seem to be doing, I'm always 2+ levels behind the solo laners.  I've been 4-0 at 15 minutes and been 2 levels behind the solo laners.  

When I'm not jungling and I get ganked, I always focus down the jungler.  It's usually a super easy kill b/c he's 4 and I'll be 6+.

There's no reason you can't take 2 small camps and red, no matter which champion you're jungling with, from Fiddlesticks to Poppy.

Downvote me sheep.

> [{quoted}](name=KMannnnn1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VIJJElJs,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-01-13T02:35:06.830+0000)
>
> The framework has been laid to increase diversity, but the new jungle is just a lot more punishing, so fewer champions can jungle effectively as it stands now. A few more patches should see some changes to finally deliver on the diversity that S5 was hoping for.

"few more patches" Yaaay so jungle will be viable at the end of the year x3

> [{quoted}](name=KMannnnn1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VIJJElJs,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-01-13T02:35:06.830+0000)
>
> The framework has been laid to increase diversity, but the new jungle is just a lot more punishing, so fewer champions can jungle effectively as it stands now. A few more patches should see some changes to finally deliver on the diversity that S5 was hoping for.

quite the opposite the jungle has been specifically framed to be extremely specialized and that is why the diversity is soo low, specialized jungle = specialized junglers. Then add onto the fact anyone who can compete with lee sin j4 in the jungle gets instantly gutted like warwick for example.... he lasted 2 weeks  had the same kit that was considered by nearly everyone to be subpar for over 2 years solid get 3 significant large nerfs because of a broken interaction with on hit on a broken item that incidentally ALSO got nerfed.

you wonder why there is no diversity? The moment another jungler can compete they get knee jerk battered by the nerf hammer, when the champion wasnt even considered good in the first fugging place. OMG i am losing to a warwick?@#$@##@? that is unacceptable warwick is supposed to be freelo must nerf NOW GUYS!@

well yeah, apparently "everybody being a viable jungler" in season 4 was a "bad thing"
and "limiting diversity" in s5 was "intentional"

> [{quoted}](name=LeagueSrsBsns,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VIJJElJs,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-01-13T02:33:48.448+0000)
>
> well yeah, apparently "everybody being a viable jungler" in season 4 was a "bad thing"
> and "limiting diversity" in s5 was "intentional"

And the community approved at first, saying that limiting choice would make it "more skillful".

when you say community
say "casual community"
cause veteran junglers wouldn't agree with limiting anything.
Espically when we already know the god tier junglers like lee/fiddle crowd out every other champion in the game atm.
Warwick got to shine because riot cant create new items for shit so warwick got gutted because riot cant balance their own items before release lol

> because riot cant balance their own items before release lol

This a thousand times. This this this. It seems like nowadays the PBE is just a preview of patch changes rather than a place to test them

"Hey warwick synergies very well with new jungle items, glad we put this on the PBE"
"let's not try to fix that while it's on the PBE and just shit on him with nerfs next patch"

what happens when you let casual rioters like ghost crawler exist.
People like him ruin games with poor balancing.

Everybody being viable in season 4 was mostly the case, especially after Quill Coat was introduced in the middle of it, but there were still some incredibly dominant junglers that pushed everyone out. It eventually became the case that damage junglers got so much sustain out of the jungle items that most sustain junglers couldn't be jungled for their sustain alone, and you had to use whatever other strengths you had in your kit. Likewise, tank junglers lost to a lot of the damage junglers in the early game, and also got pushed out because of these weaknesses.

This is mostly the case in season 5 now, but the big difference between the jungle in seasons 4 and 5 is that the jungle is now tunable to let a larger variety of champs to not only jungle, but to be healthy while jungling.

and now damage junglers have no sustain and can hardly jungle
tanks got no damage, pathetic clear times and too much sustain

everythings looking pretty good so far
Actually, a lot of tank junglers don't have a lot of sustain, while some of the stronger junglers are damage junglers.

Well, it's not worse than ever, but it is pretty poor.

The framework in the new jungle is quite good, and it has the potential to be the most diverse jungle ever, but so far they haven't managed to make strategic diversity a reality or come up with a good balance on jungler sustain.

Jungle diversity straight up sucks this season, only junglers with sustain or good camp clear are allowed to thrive I.E {{champion:64}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:19}}  while tank junglers such as {{champion:111}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:106}}  barely survive their first two camps and is depleted of half their mana. What also makes makes it worse is that they give jungle monsters more health and give them less money so you spend more time in the jungle trying to make half of what your support makes, seriously the support makes more money than the jungler which is just sad. Jungle is also more punishing to the point where if any lane falls behind or loses tower you can expect your jungle to get raided and warded by the enemy jungler. The would just live in your jungle and never leave.

To be fair, Sejuani is actually quite good now, and Volibear gets sustain through his passive and the fear (which prevents monsters from attacking). Only nautilus (of the three you mentioned) has difficulties.

Upgrading the jungle item ASAP brings your gold right up. Sure, it isn't as much as a solo lane, but it is much higher than supports.

EDIT: But your other points seem fair - I don't want to just ignore those.

your gold never gets up. anywhere near any other lane.
A support will have more items than a farming jungler/

Considering your jungle item is a 750 gold sink alone
And thats before finishing it into a damage item/defense item its just useless stats that aren't worth 700 gold BY FAR.


So you're technically 750 gold behind every other player in the entire game.
if camps spawned in 60 or less seconds then this would be fine and you could somewhat farm but they don't
riot absolutely gutted the jungle.
I feel like if spirit stone came back in some form or fashion it would be better.  Mana is so brutal in the new jungle, even with blue.

If you haven;t tried this yet, I suggest you try it now. Before you take red buff, always smite and take the krugs. Before you take blue buff, always take and smite the gromp. If you start one of these two camps, you still get to level 2 and they make clearing camps a lot easier
Riot is trying to push tanks in jungle, but top lane is their lane. However, top lane is becoming an island for mage who can't go mid anymore for the reasons we know.

So i used to have a lot of fun jungling with Rammus, so i tried it again today. 

Holy crap it was boring. Its not just with him either. Jungle is awful to play now.

Problem in champion diversity is right there in the name: "champion"

Too many champions function too similarly to allow for any real diversity to occur.  Any changes to general rules (unless the rule is specific like "only play a champion x times in y matches"), will only shift which champions are optimal for the job at hand because the champions themselves to function uniquely enough.

Kits are made with roles in mind.  We don't get a whole lot of "how does this person fit" anymore.  As long as they are approached that way they will all play within the same mental design box and thus a limited number will be viable.

To put it another way: real diversity should mean the jungle strategy should not be used every match.  Champion pool should be rich enough to function _without_ needing a jungler but a jungler still working if the comp is right.  

In summation:  forcing diversity into the jungle is no different than forcing diversity into any other lane ... aka nearly impossible.  Force diversity OF roles instead.

Without a rigid and unchanging meta, gameplay would be a lot more emergent, and emergent gameplay would make the balance teams job a lot more complicated, even if it would make esports far less dull. Every time they think they've got the game balanced, someone comes up with a game changing strategy that they'd have to reexamine things. I'm not declaring that's why Riot enforces meta, but that is my hypothesis. 

Notice how with every champion release, they are becoming increasingly less flexible in terms of role and build? Thresh tried to go ADC, but instead of making him a healthier ADC, Riot cut his viability in the role completely.

Urgot isn't 'toxic', he's just too disruptive to be allowed to be completely viable.
Every time riot says they want to increase diversity at x role, the opposite happens.
thats because it is. Most junglers that were bad before are only worse now.
Yea those camps hurt.
the lvling in the jungle sucks so hard now. idk if you have noticed but it was designed to keep you behind laners unless you tax really hard now
I *have* been doing better with tanky jungles this preseason, but I must admit bruisers like j4 and Lee still seem to be on top...
It also sucks that you make crap for gold if you try to farm, forcing you to gank. Yay for gank-or-die junglers again, amirite?
I always thought beginning of season 3 jungle was in a good spot.
Just attempted to play Kha for the first time in a long time because I got stuck with jungler.....never again.
true. My favorite jungler Nautilus was never that good but definitely playable but now he is so useless unless it gets to late game its sad
the problem is that the only champion that riot are willing to leave in god tier is lee sin. everything else that ever becomes good gets nerfed to the ground.

I think it's due to bruisers being pushed out of top lane, Riot wants them to feel viable and played and not nerf all the mages going top lane since they nerfed all the bruisers top lane. Seriously watch any lcs or ranked stream where Lissandra or Rumble is always top lane and always wins against Irelia or Gnar. I feel like the game has gotten all screwed up cause of Zed and Yasuo and other Ad casters.

Sure this is not just a meta shift?  If people always play a certain champ in certain lanes predictably then it opens up exploits by teams who think outside the box.  For example, and understand I am a noob, I was playing Darious top lane.  I am not the best player, and I have little experience with darius but the experiences I did have were positive so I wanted a little more play time with him to see if I should buy him.  I get into a game and I find myself against Annie Top lane.   I have never played against Annie top, and never against Darius in the lanning phase.  I honestly had no answer for her.  I would try and get her to use her abilities and then close but before level 6 she  was able to keep enough difference till her stun came up and then poke me down.  Due to my noobness she got a couple kills off me because she hit ALOT harder against me than I was hitting her.  Would she have a similar experience pro against pro?

yes cause annie deals more damage and is tankier and has cc

It still only heightened inefficient gankers weaknesses. The Chilling Smite nerf only makes it worse. If you can't gank, you won't be viable.
Remember to everyone saying X champ can clear or X champ has sustain, you're competing with the enemy jungler for map dominance. If they pick a Rek'Sai or Lee Sin and you don't, you are automatically at a disadvantage. So focus on faster clear, Lee ganked ur bot lane while u were farming. You try to gank, but it takes the second try to land it instead of the first. Rek gets ahead of you in gold. It's always something. Volibear is my best jungler atm and half the games I play I only spend maybe 20% of the game in the jungle? Maybe less. I gank all the time and get fed off assists. I only farm if there're no openings.
Diana is great once she hits lv.6, but then I have to wait for lv.6 which is problematic against the Reks and Lees and X champs that gank earlier. Because the XP and gold gain suck in the jungle now *with* longer spawn timers, you can't keep up by farming. It's more *interesting*, sure, but it's incredibly prohibitive and did the exact **opposite** of what was intended.

{{champion:14}} is really good in the new jungle. Start gromp with W and a good leash. Then take Q, E, then I like to max W. You clear:

1. Gromp (smite)
2. Blue (heal pot)
3. Wolves
4. Red (smite)
5. Chickens
6. Krugs

You don't even need 2nd pot unless you go in for a gank or something.

If you want stronger early ganks, max E first because of increased slow and damage. If you want more team fight cc, max Q first for reduced cooldown. I like the crazy sustain and jungle clear of maxing W first.

For runes, I take movement quints, AD marks, armor seals, 3 scaling cdr glyphs, and 6 scaling mr glyphs. Masteries I take 21/9/0 for ad damage with cdr and bonus life w/jungle tank helpers.
